entry.title: Dolly de Leon (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Dolly de Leon (pictured) was the first Filipino to be nominated for a Golden Globe or a BAFTA Award for Best Supporting Actress?

entry.title: a neighborhood in Virginia (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a neighborhood in Virginia lost its public park because its city government did not build a fence?

entry.title: Robert Ballagh (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that having painted a domestic scene depicting his nude wife, Robert Ballagh felt that he had to produce a nude painting of himself as a follow-up?

entry.title: Cascade Saddle (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that ten people have died trying to cross the Cascade Saddle?

entry.title: Maciej Grabowski (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Maciej Grabowski became the Polish minister of environment in 2013 despite having no environmental experience?

entry.title: New Zealand penny (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a design for the 1930s New Zealand penny depicted a rugby player?

entry.title: Catalogue of Works of Carl Friedrich Abel (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the new Catalogue of Works of Carl Friedrich Abel, listing 420 compositions, was introduced at a festival celebrating Abel's tercentenary in Köthen?

entry.title: Olga Hartman (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that although Olga Hartman believed that her basic research on marine worms had no practical value, it was applied to experimental studies of oysters?
